segments.en: 2. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma
“Mendicants, I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of suffering.’

segments.pli: Tattha aparimāṇā vaṇṇā aparimāṇā byañjanā aparimāṇā saṅkāsanā:
segments.en: And there are limitless explanations, phrases, and expressions about that:
‘This is another way of saying that this is the noble truth of suffering.’
I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the origin of suffering.’ …
I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.’ …

segments.pli: ‘idaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā ariyasaccan’ti, bhikkhave, mayā paññattaṃ.
segments.en: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’

segments.pli: Tattha aparimāṇā vaṇṇā aparimāṇā byañjanā aparimāṇā saṅkāsanā:
segments.en: And there are limitless explanations, phrases, and expressions about that:
‘This is another way of saying that this is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
